Phase_1_Groundskeeper: ^GROUNDSKEEPER: So you're the hotshot techy who's gonna save our town, eh?

s: ^PLAYER: Don't know about save, but I'll do my job.
^PLAYER: There's no saving this shithole. I'm just here for a paycheck.

g-0: ^GROUNDSKEEPER: Whatever you say. Well let's get this over with. This here is the town hall. You'll be working inside.

interior_intro_townhall: ^GROUNDSKEEPER: Well short tour, but this is the town hall.

^The Groundskeeper waves at a collection of dusty fold up chairs lined up in two colums with several rows of six with a narrow path between each set. A small podium, warped by age and coverd in dust and cobwebs stands alone on a slightly raised stage with tattered curtains and
intro_house_entry: ^The entryway of the house opens to a dining room with a small table and two chair. To your right is a fireplace. Opposite the fireplace to your left is a wall with a void where something ought to be. The stairs that lead to the second floor await across the room, past the kitchen.

s: ^Examine a strange empty space on the wall.
^The mantle of the fireplace has an empty wooden stand.
^A dusty coatrack looms next to the staircase leading to the bedroom.

c-0: ^PLAYER: Huh. Hooks? Looks like it was for a sword.
c-1: ^PLAYER: I wonder what this is for...
c-2: ^PLAYER: Seems as good a place as any to put my coat on.
g-0: ^I should go to bed. Long day tomorrow.

b: ^A twin bed sits against the wall in the middle of the room. A dresser sits beside it and a singular window looks out into the street.
^PLAYER: Can't say I was expecting much.

intro_demon_start: ^Your eyes flutter closed, and just as you're about to drift into sleep, you hear a creak and a grumble.
^You open your eyes and a demon is laying on top of you, crushing your chest and stifling your breath.

c-0: ^DEMON: Oh, my! So sorry to startle you like this.
c-1: ^DEMON: Oh dear. I fear I may have frightened you, but please don't worry.
g-0: ^DEMON: Well, I would have thought my, admittedly unnerving, appearance would have given it away.
^DEMON: But, what I am really isn't terribly important. We are, afterall, in your dream aren't we?

c-2: ^DEMON: Why yes! I'll prove it to you. Look at the clock.
^You do as instructed. The numbers are an illegible jumble.
c-3: ^DEMON: That's a bit harsh, but I can see why you would label me like that. So if it's easier to think of me that way then, yes. I suppose I am.

g-1: ^DEMON: Now, before we get too off-track I have...something of a proposition for you.
^DEMON: Since I am your subconcious, what do you say we go on a little bit of an adventure. You've always wanted to be a hero, yes?

c-5: ^DEMON: Well, I think you do. I think since you're dreaming about me telling you that you want to be a hero means you want to be a hero. Right?

g-2: ^DEMON: Great! Then this will be super easy. How about we go kill some monsters? I mean there's no harm in killing a bunch of monsters in a dream right?

choose_weapon: ^DEMON: Superb! Then here, every hero needs a weapon. Why don't we start with this sword?
^A sword has been added to your Inventory.
^DEMON: You know what's better than one weapon?

c-0: ^DEMON: Yes, of course, you must have gotten that confused. Moving along.
g-0: ^DEMON: And now you get to pick your second one!

c-2: ^DEMON: Excellent choice! The best offense is the best defense, right? Or was it the other way around?
c-3: ^DEMON: Perfect choice! Best to kill effectively from all ranges. Best defense is the best offence, right? Or...
c-4: ^DEMON: Yes, yes! Smash things! Make them squishy, splashy, and-- I mean, yes. Hammers have all sorts of uses.

demon_tutorial: ^>>> Player lands in the first level of the dreamscape dungeon. It's a weird warped version of the town and a hellhound is patrolling just outside the door of the house.
^DEMON: Don't worry. This is just a dream remember? That Shambling Horror can't hurt you. But it's super scary right?
^DEMON: Come now, he's not that ugly is he? Nevermind. The point is, you should go and slash him with your sword!

b:
^DEMON: Okay, now try blocking its attack.

^>>> Player successfully blocks attack.

^DEMON: Great work! Now you can also bash it. Give a try! I bet it makes a satisfying crunch.
^DEMON: Now let's try shooting it in the face!
^DEMON: Now do the same thing, but switch to your hammer.

demon_tutorial: ^DEMON: Great job! Now see that shiny, spinny thing? Go pick it up. Make sure you keep it in your pocket.
^DEMON: It's...uh...what do you think it is?
^PLAYER: Looks kind of like a candy.
^DEMON: Yes! That's candy! Absolutely. No need to ask anything more. Now go be a hero! Oh, and remember: You'll have to wake up eventually so try to the make the most of it!
demon_return: ^After a long day's work, you head back to the apartment. About to head straight upstairs, something catches your eye.

c-0: ^The sword from your dreams is resting within the mounts.

b: ^PLAYER: Weird. I thought this was empty, and I definitely think I would have remembered the shield and sword being put on there. Maybe the landlord put it up while I was working.

^Inventory hasn't manholeCover:

^PLAYER: Weird. I thought that was empty before. Must have just missed it.
^Wait. That was definitely empty before. Huh. Must have been added after. I'll have to ask the Groundskeeper if he's redecorating while I'm out.

g-0: ^You head upstairs and lay down in bed. Before you finish yawning you drift into sleep.
^PLAYER: Jesus, you scared the shit out of me.
^DEMON: I'm so sorry about that. Nothing I can do about my appearance, sadly. I mean, considering we're in your mind you must just want me to look this way.
^DEMON: Sure it does! Anyway, because you did so well the last time, do you have that candy?
^DEMON: Wanna trade me some of them for cool new things?
^PLAYER: Can't I just give myself the cool new thing?
^DEMON: Hahaha! You're so funny! Sure, you could, but apparently you don't want to since you're dreaming me asking you to give it to me.
^DEMON: Hey, don't worry about it. Anyway, let me show you what I have! Then you can go back to being a hero again!
^DEMON: All set? Ok well have fun down there!

demon_phase_1_regular_shop_open: ^DEMON: Hi, again! Want a new toy?
demon_phase_1_regular_shop_close: ^DEMON: Have fun! Remember, be the hero!

fire_chief: ^CHIEF: I don't care what you do here, city slicker, just don't make me have to work harder than I have to.
mayor: ^MAYOR: How did you get in here? Leave before I call my driver to throw you out.
sheriff: ^Sheriff: Not gonna have a problem with you am I? I know how you young millenial types like to party. If I catch one whiff of that mary jane, you will feel my wrath.
mechanic: ^TOBY: Leroy's my dad. What can I do for you?

Phase_2_Groundskeeper: ^PLAYER: Well, all I've done is cleaned up a bit. Still have a lot to go before this place is ready.
^GROUNDSKEEPER: Well gotta at least give you credit. Didn't expect someone as soft-handed as you to work this hard.

s: ^PLAYER: That's supposed to be a compliment?
^PLAYER: Don't know any other way to be.
